content.contentTitle: Go Inside One of Hollywood’s Wildest Scandals in Vanity Fair’s Newest Podcast, ‘Love Is a Crime’

head.description: In a coproduction with Cadence13, ‘Love Is a Crime’ hosts Karina Longworth and Vanessa Hope explore the dark, bygone story of film producer Walter Wanger and actor Joan Bennett.
head.keywords: old hollywood,podcasts,karina longworth,you must remember this,zooey deschanel,jon hamm,griffin dunne,love is a crime
head.title: Go Inside One of Hollywood’s Wildest Scandals in Vanity Fair’s Newest Podcast, ‘Love Is a Crime’ | Vanity Fair
head.social.title: Go Inside One of Hollywood’s Wildest Scandals in Vanity Fair’s Newest Podcast, ‘Love Is a Crime’
head.social.description: In a coproduction with Cadence13, ‘Love Is a Crime’ hosts Karina Longworth and Vanessa Hope explore the dark, bygone story of film producer Walter Wanger and actor Joan Bennett.
head.promo.dek: In a coproduction with Cadence13, Love Is a Crime hosts Karina Longworth and Vanessa Hope explore the dark, bygone story of film producer Walter Wanger and actor Joan Bennett.

head.jsonld.articleBody:
+++dropcap

Joan Bennett, leading lady of *Scarlet Street* and *The Woman in the Window,* was a famous femme fatale in 1940s film noir. The most salacious story she ever starred in, however, happened off-screen. Enter her film-producer husband, Walter Wanger, whose jealousy and rage over Bennett’s affair with an agent would lead to one of Old Hollywood’s wildest scandals.

+++

*Vanity Fair* introduces *Love Is a Crime*, a 10-episode podcast series coproduced by *V.F.* and Cadence13. [*You Must Remember This*](https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2017/04/you-must-remember-this-podcast-karina-longworth-old-hollywood){: target="_blank"} podcast creator **Karina Longworth** and filmmaker **Vanessa Hope**—the granddaughter of Bennett and Wanger—will lead listeners through a journey to unpack just how Wanger and Bennett “ended up staring at each other over another man’s bloody body in December 1951.”



[#iframe: https://embed.podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/love-is-a-crime/id1578559817?itsct=podcast_box_player&itscg=30200&ls=1&theme=auto](750x450)

*Love Is a Crime* is executive produced, created, written, and hosted by Hope and Longworth and includes a starry voice cast. The ensemble includes **Zooey Deschanel** as Joan, **Jon Hamm** as Walter, **Griffin Dunne** as agent Jennings Lang, **Mara Wilson** as Joan’s older movie-star sister, Constance, and **Adam Mortimer** as Joan’s turbulent father, Richard. This podcast is executive produced by **Chris Corcoran** alongside showrunner **Jacquelyn Jamjoom.** 

Questions abound in the series, which examines both the lead-up to Walter and Joan’s fateful 1951 encounter and its misogynistic aftermath. “Why would my grandfather, a successful movie producer, a liberal thinker, a man who helped Jewish émigrés escape Hitler, take a gun to confront his wife?” Hope asks in a preview of the podcast. “Why would my grandmother, a beautiful movie star who had all but invented the archetype of the film noir femme fatale, and was then starring in a hit franchise of family films, risk everything to sneak around with her agent?”

The first episode of *Love Is a Crime* launches on Tuesday, August 17. Listen and subscribe at [listen.vanityfair.com/loveisacrime](http://listen.vanityfair.com/loveisacrime){: target="_blank"} or wherever you get your podcasts.

### **More Great Stories From** ***Vanity Fair***
— Searching for [the Truth About Anthony Bourdain](https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2021/07/anthony-bourdain-asia-argento-roadrunner?itm_content=footer-recirc){: target="_blank"} and Asia Argento\
— How *Never Have I Ever* Tore Up the [“Immigrant Mom” Trope](https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2021/07/never-have-i-ever-season-two-immigrant-mom-trope?itm_content=footer-recirc){: target="_blank"}\
— What [*Black Widow*’s Final Minutes](https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2021/07/black-widow-end-of-credits-florence-pugh-hawkeye-julia-louis-dreyfus-natasha-funeral?itm_content=footer-recirc){: target="_blank"} Mean for the MCU’s Future\
— Can Hot People in Animal Masks [Find True Love](https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2021/07/07/sexy-beasts-dating-show-review-netflix?itm_content=footer-recirc){: target="_blank"} on *Sexy Beasts*?\
— The [Best Shows and Movies](https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2021/07/new-on-netflix-the-best-movies-and-tv-shows-coming-in-august?itm_content=footer-recirc){: target="_blank"} Coming to Netflix in August\
— The Poignant Story Behind [Anthony Bourdain’s Favorite Song](https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2021/07/anthony-bourdain-favorite-song-roadrunner-doc?itm_content=footer-recirc){: target="_blank"}\
— How [Brad and Angelina](https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2021/07/loki-sophia-di-martino-interview-finale-season-2?itm_content=footer-recirc){: target="_blank"} Inspired *Loki*’s Finale\
— The Ballad of [Bobby Darin and Sandra Dee](https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2021/07/sandra-dee-bobby-darin-relationship-marriage?itm_content=footer-recirc){: target="_blank"}\
— From the Archive: Richard Gully, [the Man Hollywood Trusted](https://archive.vanityfair.com/article/share/35b83ea0-30e2-4142-a8fc-5033bd0ef77e?itm_content=footer-recirc){: target="_blank"}\
— Sign up for the [“HWD Daily” newsletter](https://www.vanityfair.com/newsletters?itm_content=footer-recirc){: target="_blank"} for must-read industry and awards coverage—plus a special weekly edition of Awards Insider.
